metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data of huazhaizi desert station in the middle reaches of heihe hydrological meteorological observation network from January 18, 2015 to December 31, 2015.The station is located in huazhaizi, zhangye city, gansu province.Huazhaizi station is equipped with observation instruments from Beijing normal university (longitude and latitude is 100.3201E, 38.7659N) and Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute (longitude and latitude is 100.3186E, 38.7652N), with an altitude of 1,731m.The observation instrument of Beijing normal university has been installed since June 11, 2015. Specifically, the air temperature and relative humidity sensors are installed at 5m and 10m, facing due north.Install the barometer inside the waterproof box;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 5m and 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm of the surface and 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water sensor is buried 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm and 100cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil hot plates (3 pieces) are buried 6cm underground.The observation instruments set up by Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute are as follows: the wind speed sensor is set up at a height of 0.48m, 0.98m and 2.99m, with a total of three layers, facing north;The wind direction sensor is mounted at a height of 4m;Air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 1m and 2.99m respectively, with a total of 2 layers, facing north by east.The installation height of the four-component radiometer is 2.5m, facing due south;The air pressure sensor is placed in the waterproof box;The installation height of the tilting bucket rain gauge is 0.7m;The soil temperature probe is buried at depths of 4cm, 10cm, 18cm, 26cm, 34cm, 42cm and 50cm underground.The soil moisture sensors were buried underground 2cm, 10cm, 18cm, 26cm, 34cm, 42cm, 50cm and 58cm, respectively, with 3 repetitions buried in 2cm.Specific observation items are as follows:
(1) observation items of Beijing normal university : air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m RH_5m Ta_10m, RH_10m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_5m, WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit:Watts/m2), surface radiant temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: Celsius), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts/m2), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_60cm, Ms_100cm) (unit:Volume moisture content, percentage) and soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_2cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_40cm, Ts_60cm, Ts_100cm) (unit: Celsius).
(2) observation items of Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute : wind speed (WS_0. 48 m, WS_0. 98 m, WS_2. 99 m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_4m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor) (unit: watts per square meter), air temperature and humidity (Ta_1m, Ta_2. 99 m, RH_1m, RH_2 99 m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit:Mm), soil temperature (Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_18cm, Ts_26cm, Ts_34cm, Ts_42cm, Ts_50cm) (unit: Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_2cm_1, Ms_2cm_2, Ms_2cm_3, Ms_10cm, Ms_18cm, Ms_26cm, Ms_34cm, Ms_42cm, Ms_50cm, Ms_58cm) (unit: volumetric water content, percentage).
The observed elements of Beijing normal university were the mean value of 10min, and those of Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute were the mean value of 30min.
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 observation data elements of Beijing normal university every day (every 10min); Ensure the observed elements of Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute are 48 data per day (every 30min). If the data is missing, it will be marked by -6999.Due to the problem of the wind speed sensor, the 10m wind speed observed by Beijing normal university was missing between June 21-7.09, 2015 and December 16-12.25.Due to the problem of data storage, the precipitation observed by Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute is missing between 1.18 and 1.22.(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: June 10, 2015, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al. (2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al. (2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2015年1月18日至2015年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网中游花寨子荒漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市花寨子，下垫面是山前荒漠。花寨子站中分别有北师大(经纬度是100.3201E, 38.7659N)、寒旱所(经纬度是100.3186E, 38.7652N)的观测仪器，海拔1731m。其中北师大的观测仪器自2015年6月11日架设，具体为：空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速风向传感器架设在5m、10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。寒旱所的观测仪器具体架设为：风速传感器架设高度为0.48m、0.98m、2.99m，共3层，朝向北侧；风向传感器架设在4m高处；空气温度、相对湿度传感器分别架设在1m、2.99m，共2层，朝向北偏东侧；四分量辐射仪安装高度为2.5m，朝向正南；气压传感器放置于防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装高度为0.7m；土壤温度探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、18cm、26cm、34cm、42cm和50cm处；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、10cm、18cm、26cm、34cm、42cm、50cm和58cm，其中2cm埋设3个重复。具体观测要素如下：
（1）北师大观测项目：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
（2）寒旱所观测项目：风速（WS_0.48m、WS_0.98m、WS_2.99m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_4m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor）(单位：瓦/平方米)、空气温湿度（Ta_1m、Ta_2.99m、RH_1m、RH_2.99m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、土壤温度（Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_18cm、Ts_26cm、Ts_34cm、Ts_42cm、Ts_50cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm_1、Ms_2cm_2、Ms_2cm_3、Ms_10cm、Ms_18cm、Ms_26cm、Ms_34cm、Ms_42cm、Ms_50cm、Ms_58cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)。 
其中北师大观测要素为10min平均值，寒旱所的观测要素为30min平均值。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保北师大观测数据要素每天144个数据（每10min）；确保寒旱所观测要素每天48个数据（每30min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于风速传感器的问题，北师大观测的10m风速在2015.6.21-7.09和12.16-12.25之间数据缺失；由于数据存储问题，寒旱所降水量在1.18-1.22间数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而变得主导。在这封信中，显示出与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度通量（在离地4.5米处测量）。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获取的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的放大是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，这些数据集包含了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时还包括地下水位数据。此外，植被和土壤参数也被补充到数据集中。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于观察绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集的示例？

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of a hierarchically nested scale in data collection for eco-hydrological processes?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文过程的数据收集中，层次嵌套尺度的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: A hierarchically nested scale in data collection is crucial for capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, especially in regions with heterogeneous surfaces. This approach addresses the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations by using instrumentation at different scales to obtain comprehensive data. This methodology was applied in the HiWATER experiment to investigate the oasis-desert interaction, with instruments arranged to capture various eco-hydrological processes in the oasis-desert system.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在数据收集过程中，层次嵌套的尺度对于捕捉多尺度生态水文过程至关重要，特别是在表面异质性较强的地区。这种方法通过在不同尺度上使用仪器来获取全面的数据，从而解决了多尺度观测稀缺的挑战。这种方法在HiWATER实验中得到了应用，以研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用，仪器的布置旨在捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的各种生态水文过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods used in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 compare to those applied during the HiWATER experiment in terms of capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验中使用的数据收集方法与HiWATER实验中应用的方法在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 黑河生态水文遥感试验 focuses on detailed meteorological and hydrological observations at specific desert stations, employing instruments like automatic weather stations to record various atmospheric and soil parameters. In contrast, the HiWATER experiment uses a hierarchically nested instrumentation approach to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes, including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and extensive remote sensing missions with LiDAR and imaging spectrometers.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验专注于在特定沙漠站点进行详细的气象和水文观测，采用自动气象站等仪器记录各种大气和土壤参数。相比之下，HiWATER实验采用分层嵌套的仪器方法，捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪，以及使用激光雷达和成像光谱仪的广泛遥感任务。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced during data collection for the oasis–desert interactions in the HiWATER dataset compared to those encountered in the oasis–desert energy exchange dataset?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在HiWATER数据集中，关于绿洲-沙漠相互作用的数据收集面临的挑战与绿洲-沙漠能量交换数据集所遇到的挑战有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The HiWATER dataset's challenges include the poor availability of multiscale observations needed for upscaling eco-hydrological processes, while the oasis–desert energy exchange dataset addresses long-term data acquisition challenges to maintain ecological stability and support sustainable development in oasis–desert areas. Both face difficulties in capturing comprehensive data due to the complex interactions in arid environments.
Comparison.AnswerCn: HiWATER数据集面临的挑战包括缺乏多尺度观测数据，这些数据对于生态水文过程的上行尺度至关重要，而绿洲-沙漠能量交换数据集则解决了长期数据获取的挑战，以维持生态稳定性并支持绿洲-沙漠地区的可持续发展。由于干旱环境中复杂的相互作用，两者在捕捉全面数据方面都面临困难。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the varied measurement heights of sensors in different stations affect the interpretation of environmental data in hydrological studies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 不同站点传感器的测量高度差异如何影响水文研究中环境数据的解读？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The varied measurement heights, such as those of wind speed or temperature sensors at different altitudes, help capture a more comprehensive profile of meteorological conditions that are crucial for understanding microclimates and their impact on hydrological processes. This allows researchers to interpret how different layers of the atmosphere interact with the surface and influence energy and water vapor exchanges.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 不同高度的测量，如风速或温度传感器在不同海拔的高度，有助于捕捉更全面的气象条件特征，这对于理解微气候及其对水文过程的影响至关重要。这使研究人员能够解读大气不同层次如何与地表相互作用，并影响能量和水蒸气的交换。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological approaches could enhance the accuracy of estimating evapotranspiration using remote sensing and ground-based measurements?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 哪些方法论方法可以提高使用遥感和地面测量估算蒸散发的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Combining remote sensing data with ground-based measurements such as those from eddy covariance systems can improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates. Approaches like the two-source energy balance model, which separates soil and canopy temperatures, or using high-resolution thermal cameras to capture precise surface temperature data, can enhance the reliability of these estimates by addressing heterogeneity in land surface conditions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面测量（如涡度协方差系统）相结合，可以提高蒸散发估算的准确性。像两源能量平衡模型这样的 approaches，通过分离土壤和树冠温度，或使用高分辨率热像仪捕捉精确的表面温度数据，可以通过解决地表条件的异质性来增强这些估算的可靠性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in accurately measuring E and T in arid regions using current composite temperature separation approaches?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，使用当前的复合温度分离方法准确测量蒸散发（E）和蒸腾（T）面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions due to errors in the derived component temperatures, which are primarily caused by image classification errors. These errors vary with vegetation abundance, leading to misclassification of soil and vegetation pixels, causing overestimation of canopy temperature. Additionally, the strong advective environment in such regions is another factor affecting estimation accuracy.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 当前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性受到限制，主要是由于派生的组成温度存在误差，这些误差主要源于图像分类错误。这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化，导致土壤和植被像素的误分类，从而导致冠层温度的高估。此外，该地区强烈的平流环境也是影响估计准确性的另一个因素。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to obtain multiscale observations in eco-hydrological studies in heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，获取异质表面的多尺度观测是困难的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Progress is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The complexity of capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes requires hierarchically nested scales of instrumentation, which is challenging to implement and maintain in diverse landscapes. This lack of multiscale data limits the ability to effectively upscale eco-hydrological processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 进展受到多尺度观测可用性差的阻碍。捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的复杂性需要分层嵌套的仪器尺度，这在多样化的景观中实施和维护都具有挑战性。这种缺乏多尺度数据的情况限制了有效向上尺度化生态水文过程的能力。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the degradation of ecological environments in inland river basins of arid and semiarid areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致干旱和半干旱地区内陆河流流域生态环境退化的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins face ecological degradation due to factors such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These issues are exacerbated by the climatic and geographical challenges present in many inland river basins along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin and the Aral Sea basin.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临生态退化的问题，原因包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些问题在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域中，如塔里木河流域和阿拉尔海流域，因气候和地理挑战而加剧。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential effects on data accuracy when using ground-based sensors with varied measurement intervals, such as 10-minute versus 30-minute averages, in hydrometeorological observations?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用不同测量间隔（如10分钟与30分钟平均值）的地面传感器进行水文气象观测时，对数据准确性的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using ground-based sensors with different measurement intervals can lead to variations in data granularity and potential discrepancies in the temporal resolution of captured events. For instance, 10-minute averages provide more detailed temporal data compared to 30-minute averages, which might capture less variability in rapidly changing conditions. This could affect the accuracy of capturing transient meteorological phenomena and result in differing interpretations of the data, especially in heterogeneous landscapes like those studied in the Heihe River Basin.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用不同测量间隔的地面传感器可能导致数据粒度的变化和捕获事件的时间分辨率的潜在差异。例如，10分钟的平均值提供了比30分钟平均值更详细的时间数据，而后者可能在快速变化的条件下捕获的变异性较少。这可能会影响捕获瞬态气象现象的准确性，并导致对数据的不同解读，特别是在像黑河流域这样异质的景观中。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of employing advanced remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and thermal infrared cameras in capturing eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中采用先进的遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）和热红外相机，捕捉生态水文过程的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of advanced remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR and thermal infrared cameras allows for high-resolution spatial and temporal data collection, which can enhance the understanding of complex eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous landscapes. These technologies can capture fine-scale variations in vegetation, soil moisture, and temperature, which are critical for accurate evapotranspiration modeling and understanding energy and water fluxes. However, they also introduce challenges related to data processing, calibration, and the integration of diverse datasets, which need to be carefully managed to ensure data quality and usability.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 先进的遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）和热红外相机，能够进行高分辨率的空间和时间数据收集，从而增强对异质景观中复杂生态水文过程的理解。这些技术可以捕捉植被、土壤湿度和温度的细微变化，这对于准确的蒸散发建模以及理解能量和水分通量至关重要。然而，它们也带来了与数据处理、校准和多样化数据集整合相关的挑战，这些挑战需要谨慎管理，以确保数据质量和可用性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to obtain long-term observational data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中获取长期观测数据是至关重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational data in oasis–desert ecosystems are critical to quantitatively understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is essential for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality. This understanding supports ecological stability and socioeconomic development by recognizing oasis-desert interactions and ensuring sustainable oasis development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期观测数据对于定量理解能量、水蒸气和碳的交换至关重要，这对实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标至关重要。这种理解通过识别绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用，支持生态稳定和社会经济发展，并确保可持续的绿洲发展。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in setting up and calibrating meteorological instruments for data collection in an arid oasis-desert system?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
在干旱绿洲-沙漠系统中设置和校准气象仪器以进行数据收集的步骤包括：

1. 确定监测目标和所需数据类型（如温度、湿度、风速、降水量等）。
2. 选择合适的气象仪器（如温度计、湿度计、风速计、雨量计等）。
3. 选择合适的安装地点，确保仪器远离障碍物和干扰源，且能够代表研究区域的气象条件。
4. 安装仪器，确保其稳固并按照制造商的说明进行设置。
5. 进行初步的功能测试，确保所有仪器正常工作。
6. 校准仪器，使用标准参考设备进行比对，确保测量准确。
7. 记录校准数据和设置参数，以便后续参考。
8. 定期检查和维护仪器，确保其长期稳定运行。
9. 开始数据收集，并定期下载和分析数据以评估气象条件变化。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Several intensive observation periods and continuous hydrometeorological observations are carried out, with instruments arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. This includes installing eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and other instruments in different landscapes. Calibration and quality control are critical to ensure the accuracy of data collected from these instruments.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 进行多个密集观测期和连续的水文气象观测，仪器按层次嵌套的尺度布置，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。这包括在不同景观中安装涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和其他仪器。校准和质量控制对于确保从这些仪器收集的数据的准确性至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are thermal infrared images processed to separate soil and canopy temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 热红外图像是如何处理以分离土壤和冠层温度以估算蒸散发的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Thermal infrared images are processed by classifying visible and NIR images into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures are extracted from the thermal images, and then converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and soil and canopy emissivities. These temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures obtained from four-component radiometers.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 热红外图像通过使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素进行处理。从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度，然后利用来自天空的入射长波辐射以及土壤和冠层的发射率将这些温度转换为辐射温度。这些温度与从四分量辐射计获得的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed to ensure the quality and integrity of multiscale observational datasets in eco-hydrological research?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，为确保多尺度观测数据集的质量和完整性，遵循哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Quality control of multiscale observational datasets involves careful sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation. This includes synchronical ground measurements, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing, and the use of a flux observation matrix. Data processing and archiving are meticulously conducted to maintain the dataset's integrity and ensure its availability for research purposes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测数据集的质量控制涉及仔细的传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成。这包括同步的地面测量、高分辨率的航空遥感以及使用通量观测矩阵。数据处理和归档工作都经过精心进行，以维护数据集的完整性并确保其可用于研究目的。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What techniques enable the accurate measurement and separation of soil and canopy component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术能够在异质景观中准确测量和分离土壤和冠层组分的温度？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Field observations using high-resolution thermal cameras, image classification methods, and the conversion of thermal infrared temperatures to radiation temperatures enable the accurate measurement and separation of soil and canopy component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪、图像分类方法以及将热红外温度转换为辐射温度，可以在异质景观中准确测量和分离土壤和冠层成分的温度。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the estimation of evapotranspiration (ET) in heterogeneous landscapes require more complex models than those used for homogeneous areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，蒸散发（ET）的估算可能需要比在均质区域使用更复杂的模型，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In heterogeneous landscapes, the surface contains a mixture of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. This complexity requires models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model that account for separate soil and canopy temperatures to accurately estimate evaporation and transpiration, unlike one-source models that combine these components into a single source.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中，表面包含不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。这种复杂性需要像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型这样的模型，考虑土壤和冠层温度的分离，以准确估计蒸发和蒸腾，而不像将这些组件合并为单一源的一源模型。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when attempting to collect multiscale hydrometeorological data in an oasis-desert ecosystem?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在试图收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的多尺度水文气象数据时，可能会出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting multiscale hydrometeorological data in an oasis-desert ecosystem include the poor availability of multiscale observations and the need for a hierarchically nested observation network to capture the diverse eco-hydrological processes. This requires instruments like eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing technologies to be strategically placed across varied landscapes.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，收集多尺度水文气象数据面临的挑战包括多尺度观测的可用性差，以及需要建立分层嵌套的观测网络以捕捉多样的生态水文过程。这需要在不同的景观中战略性地布置涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和遥感技术等仪器。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be a need for careful quality control in datasets involving energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在涉及干旱地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集中，为什么需要进行仔细的质量控制？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Careful quality control in such datasets is necessary due to the complexity of combining multiple data types, such as turbulent fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and soil parameters. Ensuring accuracy involves detailed procedures in sensor calibration, data collection, and processing, particularly in harsh arid environments where ecological and climatic conditions can introduce additional variability.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在这样的数据集中，由于结合多种数据类型（如湍流通量、水文气象数据和土壤参数）的复杂性，仔细的质量控制是必要的。确保准确性涉及传感器校准、数据收集和处理的详细程序，特别是在恶劣的干旱环境中，生态和气候条件可能会引入额外的变异性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of the data collection methods used in capturing eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您将如何评估在异质景观中捕捉生态水文过程的数据收集方法的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods, which include hierarchically nested instrumentation and multiscale observations, are designed to address the complexity of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes. These methods seem effective as they provide comprehensive data across multiple scales, which is crucial for understanding the interactions in oasis-desert systems. However, the challenge remains in ensuring the availability and quality of multiscale observations.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法，包括分层嵌套的仪器和多尺度观测，旨在应对异质景观中生态水文过程的复杂性。这些方法似乎有效，因为它们在多个尺度上提供全面的数据，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的相互作用至关重要。然而，确保多尺度观测的可用性和质量仍然是一个挑战。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection methods can ensure the accuracy of soil and vegetation component temperature measurements in such heterogeneous landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据收集方法如何能确保在如此异质的景观中土壤和植被成分温度测量的准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The field uses ground-based measurement data applied to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration, applying models like the Craig–Gordon model. The soil and canopy component temperatures are calculated using thermal camera images, where visible and NIR images are classified into soil and canopy pixels. This method is validated against radiometric temperatures to ensure accuracy.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 该领域使用地面测量数据将蒸散发分为蒸发和蒸腾，应用如Craig-Gordon模型等模型。土壤和冠层组件的温度通过热像仪图像计算，其中可见光和近红外图像被分类为土壤和冠层像素。该方法通过与辐射温度进行验证，以确保准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges involved in collecting multi-scale observational data in oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度观测数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in this field stem from the poor availability of multiscale observations. To address this, experiments like HiWATER use instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, including superstations, EC towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing, to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 该领域的挑战源于多尺度观测的稀缺。为了解决这个问题，像HiWATER这样的实验使用分层嵌套尺度的仪器，包括超级站、生态系统（EC）塔、自动气象站和遥感技术，以捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't figure out how continuous hydrometeorological observations are integrated into datasets for long-term energy and water vapor exchange studies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法弄清楚连续的水文气象观测是如何整合到长期能量和水汽交换研究的数据集中的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Continuous hydrometeorological observations are integrated through an observation system consisting of flux observation matrices, eddy covariance towers, and automatic meteorological stations. These provide data on radiation, soil heat flux, air temperature gradients, and more, which are essential for long-term studies of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 连续的水文气象观测通过一个观测系统整合，包括通量观测矩阵、涡度协方差塔和自动气象站。这些设备提供辐射、土壤热通量、空气温度梯度等数据，这些数据对于在绿洲-沙漠地区进行能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期研究至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please discuss the techniques used to ensure data quality and control in multiscale observation datasets for eco-hydrological processes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请讨论确保生态水文过程的多尺度观测数据集的数据质量和控制的技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data quality and control in multiscale observation datasets are ensured through sensor calibration, data processing, and thorough quality control measures. These include handling data collection and archiving processes, as well as implementing rigorous quality checks to handle multiscale and multidisciplinary data challenges.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测数据集的数据质量和控制通过传感器校准、数据处理和严格的质量控制措施得以确保。这些措施包括处理数据收集和归档过程，以及实施严格的质量检查，以应对多尺度和多学科数据挑战。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential approaches for expanding datasets on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid and semi-arid ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在干旱和半干旱生态系统中扩展能源、水蒸气和碳交换数据集的潜在方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Expanding datasets in these ecosystems can involve integrating additional remote sensing techniques such as LiDAR and multi-angle thermal imaging, increasing the spatial and temporal resolution of observations, and extending the network of observation stations to include more diverse landscapes. Long-term data collection and using advanced modeling techniques could also contribute to a more comprehensive understanding of these exchanges.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在这些生态系统中扩展数据集可能涉及整合额外的遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）和多角度热成像，增加观测的空间和时间分辨率，并扩展观测站网络以涵盖更多样化的景观。长期数据收集和使用先进的建模技术也可以有助于更全面地理解这些交换。
